title: What are the best ways to pass time during a boring class? - Quora
tags: Tips and Hacks for Everyday Life

response.answer_text: Grab a pencil and start shredding the eraser into tiny pieces, and then dump it down the back of someone's shirt.Pretend that you are underwater and you have to stand on top of a desk to breathe.Make a high pitched whining sound and blame it on your friend.Write the number 5 and 6 and then give one to the person on your right and one to the person on your left.Write a message behind someone's ear and then ask if they hear anything.See if you can pull the lead out of your pencil, and then grind the lead into powder and then throw it into the air like confetti.Take 2,187 pictures of the teacher and then place then into a slide show in reverse order.Bob your head in time with imaginary music.Write down the word “Hi” 78 times and then give one to all of your classmates. Give the remaining ones to the teacher.Write a 3,000 word essay about how wonderful your teacher is.Stare at someone with your creepiest smile until they notice.Give your teacher 3 apples.Write down what the teacher is saying and change all the punctuations.Try to make as many of your bones pop as possible. Then scream every time one does pop.Get up and sing a solo about the movie Solo (Star Wars) and pretend you are on the Millennium Falcon. Once you are done with your solo about Solo then you go around the classroom and exclaim about how real looking the Millennium Falcon is.Measure how fast the sleeping kid’s drool is falling.Get into an argument about whether the sky really is blue or if it’s actually azure or yale or another one of these- 24 Shades of Blue Color Palette.Scream “I love peanut butter” 87 times if anyone says that they don’t like peanut butter.Pretend you are sleeping and then snore loudly and drool everywhere so the janitor has to clean it up.Sit still and listen to the teacher for once.Plan how to take over the world so you don’t have to do school anymore.Write an answer on Quora about things to do in a boring class.Wink at everybody.Set up a opera performance with your friends, and then ask for a A+ for creativity.Crumple up paper and build a model of your house.Build a nuclear rocket and hitch a ride to space on it to impress your friends.

Back in high school, I had a trigonometry class so boring, I often found myself physically holding my eyes open to stop from falling asleep. I would ask to use the bathroom and do jumping jacks or speedwalk around the building just to get some wakeup circulation. The teacher was also a stickler for rules and constantly on the lookout for any phone use, doodling, or dozing off.  accurate depiction of how everyone felt in that class So I eventually turned to my thoughts. I wanted to find out just what made a person boring. I intently studied the variance in speed and tone of the teacher’s voice compared to my classmates’ when they answered questions. I listened to the teacher’s vocabulary, counting the pauses, fillers and length of words used. I also used the time for worldbuilding my then work-in-progress scifi novel (it’s out now). I couldn’t write in class, but I before class, I would plan out what I would think about. I came up with backstories for characters, economic policies of countries, and the tactics used in battles all while staring glassy-eyed at the whiteboard. I mentally memorized specific wordings of scenes I would later write. Sometimes I could get away with taking “notes” that were just sentences I would use for the book. In the end, I passed the class and swiftly forgot everything related to trigonometry. Never once have I come close to needing it, and neither did anyone else I know. We’re raising a generation of kids who know advanced mathematics but not how to maintain their own car, pay taxes, or budget their income. We overload on trinomial factoring while being totally unable to express our ideas in words. We judge people’s worthiness for hiring based on a number that reflects their ability to calculate the cosecant of a wave form, but allow people to vote without knowing the three branches of government! It’s a faustian bargain that can only end in disaster.
